page.title: 08Thorpe House Farm
page.content: Mr and Mrs Calvert farm the land around Thorpe House, they have 192 acres, it is very spread out and hilly. In Spring time they get up at 6.00, in Summer 6.30, and in Winter 7.30, in the morning. They finish working on the farm at 5.30 in Winter and when it gets dark in Summer. Mr. and Mrs. Calvert have always lived on a farm. They have eighty Suckler cows, Suckler cows are beef cows, with a bull, calving once a year. The calves suckle their dams until Autumn when they are sold for fattening on lowland pastures. They also have two bulls. They have 140 sheep. All the ewes have 1.5 lambs. The horn burn which they put on their sheep is IC. They shear their sheep in July. Their wool is sent to the market at Malton.
